<script type="text/javascript">
/** @param {jQuery} $ jQuery Object */
!function($, window, document, _undefined)
{
	XenForo.ToogleMeOptionListener = function($element) { this.__construct($element); };
	XenForo.ToogleMeOptionListener.prototype =
	{
		__construct: function($element)
		{
			$element.one('keypress', $.context(this, 'createChoice'));
			$element.find('input[type=checkbox]').attr('checked', false);
			$element.find('input[type=text]').val('');

			this.$element = $element;
			if (!this.$base){
				this.$base = $element.clone();
			}
		},
		createChoice: function()
		{
			var $new = this.$base.clone(),
				nextCounter = this.$element.parent().children().length + 1; //Add 1

			$new.find('input[name], select[name]').each(function(){
				var $this = $(this);
				$this.attr('name', $this.attr('name').replace(/\[(\d+)\]/, '[' + nextCounter + ']'));
			});

			$new.find('*[id]').each(function(){
				var $this = $(this);
				$this.removeAttr('id');
				
				var uniqId = XenForo.uniqueId($this);
				$this.parent().attr('for', uniqId);

				if (XenForo.formCtrl){
					XenForo.formCtrl.clean($this);
				}
			});

			$new.xfInsert('insertAfter', this.$element);
			this.__construct($new);
		}
	};

	XenForo.register('li.ToogleMeOptionListener', 'XenForo.ToogleMeOptionListener');
}
(jQuery, this, document);
</script>

Use this to disable toggleME when necessary.

The logic is simple, if the user language is found inside this configuration, then the categories of his language will be opened and the ones of other languages will be closed; providing the user didn't choose to open/close them (cookie memory).

When you select a category in this configuration, it become then a "language category". Which means if the user language is not found, it will be closed. So if you set an undefined language code (ie: "default"), all the categories in it will be closed unless they are found in another language configuration and this language configuration matches the user language information.

To delete a configuration, just delete its language code and save.

Enable to automatically toggle some categories by user language? P.S: </br> (1) The user language source is the php variable "HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE"</br> (2) The information of this source can't be fully trusted</br> (3) If you need to access the code and perform some php operation, just edit the class "Sedo_ToggleME_Helper_CustomLanguage"</br> (4) The language configuration will not override the option "Default Closed XenForo Categories"
Fallback language - Keep language categories opened?

When the user language is not in your configuration, the default behaviour is to close the categories since he should not be able to read these categories using different languages. If you want instead to keep the categories open, check this option.

By default, only the first part of the language subtag will be used ('en' instead of 'en-us'). If you want to use the full language code ('en-us'), just enable this option and don't forget to modify the language codes in your configuration option below.

<xen:comment>Configure here button for categories with & without child</xen:comment>
.toggle_me.tglWchild.pcss,
.toggle_me.tglNOchild.pcss
{  
	display: inline;
	float: right;
	width: 11px;
	height: 11px;
	font-size: 11px;	
	margin-right: 3px;
	border: 1px solid {xen:property toggleMe_pureCssModeCatColor};
	color: {xen:property toggleMe_pureCssModeCatColor};
	opacity: 0.65;
	font-family: Arial, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, sans-serif;
	-webkit-border-radius: 2px;
	-moz-border-radius: 2px;
	border-radius: 2px;
	-webkit-box-shadow: 1px 1px 2px -1px rgba(55, 50, 50, 0.5);
	-moz-box-shadow:1px 1px 2px -1px rgba(55, 50, 50, 0.5);
	box-shadow: 1px 1px 2px -1px rgba(55, 50, 50, 0.5);
	cursor: pointer;
}	

.toggle_me.tglNOchild.pcss
{  
	margin-top: -4px;
}	

.toggle_me.tglWchild.pcss > span:after,
.toggle_me.tglNOchild.pcss > span:after
{
	display: block;
	text-align: center;
	position: relative;
	line-height:11px;
	vertical-align:middle;
}

.toggle_me.tglWchild.pcss.active > span:after,
.toggle_me.tglNOchild.pcss.active > span:after
{
	content:"–";
	top: -1px;
}

.toggle_me.tglWchild.pcss.inactive > span:after,
.toggle_me.tglNOchild.pcss.inactive > span:after
{
	content:"+";
}
